title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.3. SEVERE ACUTE MALNUT. CARE &NUTRITION IN EMERGENCY

description.narrative: By 2024, at least 75 per cent of children with severe acute malnutrition (SAM), each year, in targeted settings and provinces specially with emergencies and other forms of vulnerabilities receive quality SAM treatment.

mailing-address.narrative: Boulevard. du 30 Juin No. 87 Building de la Communauté Hellenique Commune de la Gombe B.P. 7248 Kinshasa

sector.narrative: Capacity building for nutrition preparedness and response

Technical assistance - Treatment of severe acute malnutrition

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2024, at least 75 per cent of children with severe acute malnutrition (SAM), each year, in targeted settings and provinces specially with emergencies and other forms of vulnerabilities receive quality SAM treatment.

Percentage of health facilities reaching more than 75% of cure rate for the management of SAM
